snippet: The battle with government security forces came hours before President Vladimir V. Putin gave his State of the Nation speech. He made only a passing reference to the violence.
abstract: Islamist militants and government security forces in Chechen capital of Grozny engage in violent gun battle that leaves 20 people dead; action comes hours before Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin's State of the Nation speech, but he only makes passing reference to attack; analysts speculate that assault was carried out by fighters linked to the Islamic State or other radical groups fighting in Syria.

byline.original: By ANDREW E. KRAMER and NEIL MacFARQUHAR
byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer reported from Grozny, and Neil MacFarquhar from Moscow. Andrew Roth contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: The battle with government security forces came hours before President Vladimir V. Putin gave his State of the Nation speech. He made only a passing reference to the violence.

headline.main: Fierce Attack by Islamist Militants in Chechen Capital Kills at Least 20
headline.print_headline: Fierce Attack by Islamist Militants in Chechen Capital Kills at Least 20

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
